entityId.localType: National Archives of Australia Reference Number

nameEntry.part: Moss John - visiting Child Welfare Expert

biogHist.abstract: 'Moss John - visiting Child Welfare Expert' is a file held by the National Archives of Australia. It documents the arrangements for a 1951-1952 visit to Children's Homes and State child welfare authorities by John Moss CBE, a 'UK Child Expert' who worked for the Home Office in Britain, to assess the conditions in institutions for British child migrants. The file also holds some information from West Australian institutions, supplied for Moss' report. It can be read online.
biogHist.p: 'Moss John - visiting Child Welfare Expert' documents the arrangements for a visit to Children's Homes and State child welfare authorities by John Moss CBE, a 'UK Child Expert' who worked for the Home Office in Britain. Moss was inspecting institutions which held British child migrants. He was doing this 'unofficially' while on holiday leave in Australia and New Zealand. Much of this file contains correspondence about John Moss' itinerary and travel arrangements for his January 1952 visit to Western Australia.
Notable information in the file includes:

list.item: Survey questions which were circulated to institutions before Moss' visit (pp.136-137)
Response to questions by Fairbridge Farm School, Pinjarra (pp.39-40)
Response to questions by Anglican (Swan Homes) (pp.41-42)
Response to questions by Methodist Homes for Children (p.43)
Response to questions by the Catholic Episcopal Migration and Welfare Association (pp.47-50)
Key officials for the WA institutions and government (pp.22, 59)
Minutes of a meeting with representatives of the institutions, Child Welfare Department and Commonwealth Department of Lands and Immigration (pp.44-46)

cpfRelation.relationEntry: National Archives of Australia - Perth Office (1998 - )

resourceRelation.relationEntry: 'Moss John - visiting Child Welfare Expert', in Find & Connect - Western Australia,

bibref.title: Moss John - visiting Child Welfare Expert

archref.abstract: 'CEMWA Response to Moss Questionnaire' is an excerpt from the digital copy of the Moss John - visiting Child Welfare Expert file from the National Archives of Australia website. There is an undated letter from the Catholic Episcopal Migration and Welfare Association Inc, responding to questions about Bindoon, Clontarf, Castledare,Nazareth House, St Joseph's Orphanage (including St Vincent's Foundling Home), and Tardun. There is also a letter, dated 14 August 1951, from the Under Secretary for Lands and Immigration passing on further information about staffing at those institutions.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Methodist Homes for Children Response to Moss Questionnaire

archref.unittitle: Methodist Homes for Children Response to Moss Questionnaire
archref.abstract: 'Methodist Homes for Children Response to Moss Questionnaire' is an excerpt from the digital copy of the Moss John - visiting Child Welfare Expert file from the National Archives of Australia website. It is a letter from the Methodist Homes for Children, responding to questions about the Methodist Children's Home, Victoria Park, and Werribee Farm School.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Anglican Homes Response to Moss Questionnaire

archref.unittitle: Anglican Homes Response to Moss Questionnaire
archref.abstract: 'Anglican Homes Response to Moss Questionnaire' is an excerpt from the digital copy of the Moss John - visiting Child Welfare Expert file from the National Archives of Australia website. It is a letter from the Anglican Homes for Children, responding to questions about the Swan Homes, Midland.

'Fairbridge Response to Moss Questionnaire' is an excerpt from the digital copy of the Moss John - visiting Child Welfare Expert file from the National Archives of Australia website. It is a letter from the Fairbridge Society, responding to questions about Fairbridge Farm School Pinjarra.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Enquiry by Mr. John Moss. Points on which information is needed as to provision for the welfare of children emigrating from the United Kingdom to Australia

archref.unittitle: Enquiry by Mr. John Moss. Points on which information is needed as to provision for the welfare of children emigrating from the United Kingdom to Australia
archref.abstract: 'Enquiry by Mr. John Moss. Points on which information is needed as to provision for the welfare of children emigrating from the United Kingdom to Australia' is an excerpt from the digital copy of the Moss John - visiting Child Welfare Expert file from the National Archives of Australia website. It is the questionnaire that was circulated to government, the organisations that received and placed child migrants, and the children's Homes where the children lived. This questionnaire was received by the Commonwealth Government on 10 May 1951.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Minutes of conference of representatives of institutions accommodating migrant children

archref.unittitle: Minutes of conference of representatives of institutions accommodating migrant children
archref.abstract: Minutes of conference of representatives of institutions accommodating migrant children' is an excerpt from the digital copy of the Moss John - visiting Child Welfare Expert file from the National Archives of Australia website. It gives insight into the process of migrating children to Australia from Britain, and the inspection of their welfare after they arrive.
